meanings.definition: A type of fish found in rocky areas.
meanings.sent1: The rockfish swam gracefully among the rocks.
meanings.sent2: We caught a big rockfish while fishing near the shore.
meanings.sent3: Why did the rockfish bring a tiny guitar to the underwater concert?
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as strong as a rockfish navigating through rough waters.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering scales of the rockfish sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: We decided to rockfish at the lake this weekend.
meanings.sent2: He loves to rockfish early in the morning when the water is calm.
meanings.sent3: Do you think we can rockfish for compliments at the party?
meanings.sent4: She hoped to rockfish for solutions to her problems in the library.
meanings.sent5: The team planned to rockfish for clues to solve the mystery.

meanings.definition: A person who is skilled at climbing rocks.
meanings.sent1: The rockfish effortlessly scaled the steep cliff.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the best rockfish in the climbing club.
meanings.sent3: The rockfish decided to take up skydiving for a change of scenery.
meanings.sent4: His agility on the rocks was compared to that of a nimble rockfish.
meanings.sent5: The young rockfish inspired others with his fearless ascent up the mountain.
